docs.lead_paragraph: Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan has joined a number of medical centers around the country in creating a special emergency room for geriatric patients.

headline.seo: Geriatric Emergency Units Opening at U.S. Hospitals
headline.main: For the Elderly, Emergency Rooms of Their Own
headline.print_headline: For Elderly, E.R.’s of Their Own

docs.abstract: Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan joins a number of medical centers around the country in creating a special emergency room for geriatric patients; hospital officials say that people over age 65 account for 15 percent to 20 percent of emergency room visits, and that number is expected to grow as the population ages.
docs.snippet: Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan has joined a number of medical centers around the country in creating a special emergency room for geriatric patients.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG NEWS

docs.lead_paragraph: Money for the primary training program for dislocated workers is 18 percent lower than it was in 2006, even though there are six million more people looking for work now.

headline.seo: Federal Funds to Train Jobless Are Drying Up
headline.main: Federal Funds to Train the Jobless Are Drying Up
headline.print_headline: Funds to Train Jobless in U.S. Are Drying Up

docs.abstract: Work force centers across the country that assist the unemployed are being asked to do more with less as federal funds dwindle for job training and related services; federal money for the primary training program for dislocated workers is 18 percent lower than it was in 2006; funds used to provide basic job search services, like guidance on resumes and coaching for interviews, have fallen by 13 percent; such cuts in funds for training have passed with little debate and little notice.
docs.snippet: Money for the primary training program for dislocated workers is 18 percent lower than it was in 2006, even though there are six million more people looking for work now.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors’ groups have made pioneering lists of unnecessary exams that are commonly used but have no proven benefit for many patients.

headline.seo: Do You Really Need That Medical Test?

docs.abstract: Editorial applauds nine doctors' groups for identifying 45 tests and procedures that are commonly used but have no proven benefit for many patients and sometimes cause more harm than good; asserts that identifying needless procedures is the first step toward controlling rising health care costs; cautions patients that they must take responsibility as well and discipline themselves not to request care of little or no value.
docs.snippet: Doctors’ groups have made pioneering lists of unnecessary exams that are commonly used but have no proven benefit for many patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: Why are “centrists” falling for fiscal flimflam and joining the cult of Paul Ryan?
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column examines why self-identified 'centrists' are coming to the defense of Rep Paul Ryan, after Pres Obama correctly criticized the budget passed by House Republicans, which was primarily authored by Ryan; asserts that these centrists refuse to let go of the fantasy that Ryan is a moderate, and are unjustly labeling Obama a partisan.
docs.snippet: Why are “centrists” falling for fiscal flimflam and joining the cult of Paul Ryan?

docs.lead_paragraph: America needs to train dental therapists who can provide preventive care and perform routine procedures outside traditional dentists’ offices.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Louis W Sullivan draws attention to the fact that many Americans are not getting preventive dental care, resulting in unnecessary emergency room visits and, in some cases, death; attributes this lack of care to a shortage of dentists, particularly in rural and poor areas; contends that an immediate solution is the training of dental therapists, which are common in many other countries.
docs.snippet: America needs to train dental therapists who can provide preventive care and perform routine procedures outside traditional dentists’ offices.
